argumentText:
The proof is very easy by induction on the number of elements of the set
$E$ of edges. If $E$ is empty, then all the vertices have degree zero,
which is even. Suppose $E$ is nonempty. If the graph contains no cycle,
then some vertex has degree $1$, which is odd. Finally, if the graph
does contain a cycle $C$, then every vertex has the same degree mod $2$
with respect to $E-C$, as it has with respect to $E$, and we can
conclude by induction.
